strapiGuide.title: NWA Daily's Guide to Parks in Rogers, AR
strapiGuide.description: Explore the natural beauty of Rogers, Arkansas with a visit to one of the city's many beautiful and diverse parks. From Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area's 54-mile trail system and primitive campsites to Lake Atalanta Park & Trails's fishing lake, off-road bike trail, and playground, there's something for everyone. Railyard Park is perfect for a fun day out with the kids, with a playground and splash pad. Discover the hidden gems of Northwest Arkansas and enjoy a variety of recreational activities such as hiking, biking, fishing, picnicking and more. Visit Rogers' parks today and explore the beauty of nature
strapiGuide.content:
Welcome to Rogers, Arkansas, home to a variety of beautiful parks that offer a range of recreational activities for visitors of all ages. One of the most popular parks in the area is Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area, the largest state park in Arkansas, spanning 12,054 acres of Ozark landscape along the southern shore of Beaver Lake. The park offers a 54-mile trail system with hiking, mountain biking, and horseback riding trails, as well as primitive campsites. Another popular spot is Lake Atalanta Park & Trails, a 236-acre park that includes the Railyard Bike Park, fishing lake, off-road bike trail, pavilion, picnic areas, playground, and more. Railyard Park is also a must visit spot for its fun playground, splash pad, and picnic tables, and the Butterfield Stage where Railyard Live takes place.

Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area

üìç20201 E Hwy 12

NWA Daily

Hobbs is Arkansas' largest state park, and it's right here in our backyard!! It spans 12,054 acres of Ozark landscape along the southern shore of Beaver Lake. The park is for day use and includes a 54-mile trail system with hiking, ADA accessible, mountain biking, and horseback riding trails. There are 11 primitive campsites and six are accessible by mountain biking only.

Lake Atalanta Park & Trails

üìç500 E Walnut St.

Photo courtesy of the City of Rogers

Lake Atalanta Park is a 236-acre park that includes the Railyard Bike Park. There is a fishing lake, an off-road bike trail, a paved stone walkway, a pavilion, picnic areas, a unique playground, and much more. We love going here for a nature walk and it's perfect for an outing with the kids!

Facebook


Railyard Park

üìç216 S 1st St

NWA Daily

The Railyard Park is such a fun spot in Downtown Rogers! Primarily a play place and splash pad for kids, it's right next to the Frisco Plaza which is lined with picnic tables, and the Butterfield Stage where Railyard Live takes place.

Rogers, Arkansas offers a wide range of beautiful parks that cater to different interests and activities. Whether you're looking for a place to hike, bike, fish, or simply enjoy nature, you can find it in one of Rogers' many parks. Hobbs State Park-Conservation Area and Lake Atalanta Park & Trails are must-visit spots for nature lovers and adventure seekers. Railyard Park is perfect for a fun day out with the kids and family. With so much to offer, Rogers' parks are the perfect destination for an outdoor adventure and a chance to enjoy the beauty of nature. So don't wait any longer, come and explore the great outdoors in Rogers today.
